description: Two storey side / rear extension; single storey rear extension, single storey porch extension, rear roof extension in conjunction with conversion of property into two self-contained flats with associated amenity space, parking for 2 cars and refuse storage.
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  Reason:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title numbers: Location Plan (No Ref), Existing Floor Plans (13NG/P100), Proposed Floorplans (13NG/P101A), Proposed Elevations (13NG/P102A), unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local Planning Authority.  Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building.  Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 4.1, 5.5 and 5.9 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), and policies 7.4-7.6 of the London Plan (2011). | Details of the position, design, materials and type of boundary treatment to be erected or retained at the site shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The details as approved shall be implemented prior to the first use of the residential flats hereby approved, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority  Reason: To protect the visual appearance of the area and the living conditions of neighbouring occupiers in accordance with policies 4.1, 5.5 and 5.9 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), and policies 7.4-7.6 of the London Plan (2011). | No part of the roof of the extension shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties, in accordance with policies 4.1, 5.5 and 5.9 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), and policies 7.4-7.6 of the London Plan (2011). | The development shall be constructed to Lifetime Homes standards unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.   Reason: To ensure access for all future occupiers, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.3 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), and policy 7.2 of the London Plan (2011). | The car parking spaces shown on the approved plan shall be marked out on the site prior to first occupation of any part of the dwellings hereby approved, and these space shall be kept continuously available for car parking and shall not be used for any other purpose, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority. 	 Reason: To ensure that there is provision for car parking within the site, in accordance with policy 9.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), and policies 6.3 and 6.13 of the London Plan (2011). | Details of refuse and recycling storage and management arrangements shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The details as approved shall be implemented prior to the first use of the residential flats hereby approved, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority  Reason: To ensure that adequate refuse storage and management arrangemets are implemented at the site and to protect the visual appearance of the area and the living conditions of neighbouring occupiers in accordance with policies 2.10, 4.1, 5.5 and 5.9 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), and policies 7.4-7.6 of the London Plan (2011).
